title: SB 1.19.9-10 Part 4 | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | 12-05-2023 | Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyanati Miran Dhasya Gyananjan Shalakaya
Chakshurun Militam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnu Padaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale
Srimate Bhakti Vedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine
Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatyade Shatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda
Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shiva Sadhigaura Bhakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya
Naram Chaiva Narottamam Deveem Saraswateem Vyasam
Tato Jayam Udi Rayet
In this session we will be discussing from the same two verses which we have been discussing
in the past three sessions. This is part four.
Of the two verses nine and ten of the nineteenth chapter of the first canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
These two verses describe the list of great saintly persons who arrived at the spot where
Parikshit Maharaj had decided to retire to the holy place on the bank of the river Ganga
not to prepare himself for going back to Godhead.
So.
For the description is now being given in the purport ah by Shri La Prabhu Par the description
of Vishva Mitra Muni or Rishi famous personality Vishva Mitra, you would have heard the name
many times you would have heard the name.
So, he is also called as Gadhi Suta son of Gadhi.
So, Shri La Prabha Par describes a brief history.
this great sage a great sage of austerity and mystic power all these
sages are famous for having performed severe austerities and by dint of
performing austerities they acquire mystic power and that mystic power is
extraordinary mystic power which actually ordinary people cannot have
ordinary people cannot have it is just like I may have some power you may have
some power somebody else may also have some power but there is a difference in
their extent to which we can utilize that power for different
purposes this like take for example the amount of physical strength now an adult
has more physical strength than a small child but among different adults
different adults have different degrees of physical strength now when you
compare the physical strength of a human being on this earth to the physical
strength of a woman
heavenly devata then the devata will have many many many times more physical strength than the
human beings of course when i say physical strength the devatas don't have a physical body
i mean the strength material strength the bodily strength possessed due to material position
so devatas have many times more power more strength more knowledge more intelligence
more beauty more wealth more facilities longer duration of life than humans on the earth
this is a general description but there is a gradation so the mystic power possessed by
great sages who are living in the
topmost planets like maharloka janloka tapoloka satyaloka the topmost planets in this universe
they have a very very very long duration of life some of them have a duration of life as much that
of brahma himself some live for several kalpas a kalpa is a day of brahma which is 1000 cycle of
four yugas on the earth
planet 1000 cycle of four yugas is something like four billion years on the earth so there
are saintly persons whose duration of life is four billion years we can't even imagine
how long the duration of life they live but still a long duration of life does not mean
that they are free from
the material conditions of birth and death the material miseries of birth and death that is never
absent even in the topmost planet called brahma loka so there is always the fear of death even
for lord brahma what to speak of others so the
duration of life is fantastically long but still they have to face death and for that they have to be prepared
so they are always anxious how to actually leave this body at the time of death so as to be able to
go back to godhead become free from the repetition of birth and death in this material world

further description vishwamitra is famous as gadi sutta because his father was gadi a powerful king of the province of kanyakubja a province of uttar pradesh although he was a kshatriya by birth he became a brahmana in the very same body by the power of his spiritual achievements
vishwamitra was a very very great tapasvi he performed severe austerities and he became a brahmana became a brahmana means qualified to become a brahmana because of his tapasya
he picked a quarrel with vasishta muni when he was a kshatriya king
it is described briefly in the description under vasishta you would have heard this in a previous
session that vasishta was having one kamadhenu one special cow which would give as much milk as
one desires whenever one desires to have milk that's a kamadhenu and vasishta was using that
milk given by kamadhenu the cow special cow
for his performing daily sacrifice sacrifice means ah one has to offer ah huge quantities
of ghee in a sacrificial fire of course the kind of sacrifice one does there are varieties
of sacrifice one can do as a recommend in scriptures so if one performs a fire sacrifice
one requires several ingredients of which the most important ingredient for a fire sacrifice
is a cow ghee
oh you
so such cow ghee ah is obtained by taking the milk of a cow and then ah turning that
milk into yogurt or curds dahi and churning that dahi to get butter and heating that butter
to make it into ghee
wonderful properties and qualities so such huge quantities of ghee are required for performing
a fire sacrifice especially the saintly persons the sages they perform fire sacrifice for
the sake of universal welfare see the way the universe is made is that our necessities
are supplied according to the system of sacrifice that is carried out by the different human
beings in different parts of this world and different parts of the universe so the more
the sacrifice that is performed the better the supply of necessities for the different
people of this material world.
We cannot manufacture any of the things that are supplied by mother nature but the supply
by nature is dependent on our performing sacrifice so the sages because they desire the welfare
of all living beings they are engaged in welfare activity for others that is the definition
of the.
sadhu one of the meanings of the word sadhu means a saintly person who lives for the benefit of
others for the welfare of others so therefore a sadhu is always engaged in
pious activities which guarantee sufficient supply of all the necessities for all the
living entities in this material world by mother nature so vasishtha muni was having the kamadhenu
and this vishwamitra as the king was visiting was going to the forest and he happened to come
to the ashram of vasishtha muni and he was received very nicely by vasishtha muni given a
grand reception so he was curious how is this saintly person living in the forest
a
to give me a grand reception while of course I am a king I am very pleased with the reception
I have received but what is the source of wealth by which he has given such a grand reception so
he found out this that Vasishtamuni had a kamadhenu so when he learned that Vasishtamuni
had a kamadhenu he became very much desirous of getting such a kamadhenu now such kamadhenu
is not available anywhere and everywhere so he decided that he is going to take away that
kamadhenu from Vasishta and that is how a quarrel began so therefore Srila Prabhupada says he picked
up a quarrel with Vasishtamuni when he was a Kshatriya king because Vasishtamuni
he requires that cow for his sacrifice but this Vishwamitra forcibly took it away and then there
was a big fight and so many things happened and some details are given elsewhere but it is just
mentioned that when he realized his mistake Vishwamitra then he decided to retire from his
kingly position.
And he decided to perform austerities to purify himself of all the reactions so he began very
severe austerities and he also performed a great sacrifice in cooperation with Matangamuni
and thus was able to vanquish the sons of Vasishta.
He became a great yogi and yet, he failed to check his senses and thus was obliged to
become the father of Shakuntala the beauty queen of world history.
So, he actually fathered a child, Shakuntala daughter.
He was above what wasblooming6shakuntala which means theory is not laquelleב׏
care 이 비밀기
who was raised by one Kanva Rishi, when Indra sent Menaka from the heavenly planet from Apsara
to distract this Vishwamitra Rishi when he was performing severe tapasya,
because Indra is afraid of somebody else taking away his position as the king of heaven. So,
when somebody is performing tapasya to accumulate Punya, they automatically accumulate Punya when
they perform tapasya. So, Indra is afraid that somebody else will exceed his Punya,
Indra's Punya and take away his position. So, he tries to distract them from performing tapasya.
So, he sends this Apsaras who will entice such saintly persons or sages to give up their
performing the tapasya and simply enjoy life with the Apsara. So, Menaka came and Vishwamitra
did get distracted by Menaka and later on he realized that he was distracted because of
Menaka's enticing him and he gave up Menaka and Menaka's company and continued his tapasya.
So, Srila Prabhupada describes here, once as a Kshatriya king, he visited the hermitage of Vasishtha Muni.
He was given a royal reception. Vishwamitra wanted Vasishtha's Kamadhenu named Nandini,
but Vasishtha would not give it. Vishwamitra stole the cow and there is a quarrel between the sage
Vasishtha and the king Vishwamitra. Vishwamitra was defeated by Vishwamitra and Vishwamitra was
defeated by the spiritual strength of Vasishtha. Thus, Vishwamitra decided to become a brahmana
and before becoming a brahmana, he underwent severe austerity on the bank of Kaushika.
So, this is the history of Vishwamitra in brief given by Srila Prabhupada.
I will stop here. Thank you very much. Hare Krishna.
